title: 115_hr5030
content: The "Small and Rural Community Clean Water Technical Assistance Act" is introduced to provide technical assistance for small treatment works under Title II of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. The "Small and Rural Community Clean Water Technical Assistance Act" defines a qualified nonprofit small treatment works technical assistance provider as a nonprofit organization experienced in providing training to small treatment works serving up to 10,000 individuals. The Administrator may use funds to provide grants or cooperative assistance. The Small and Rural Community Clean Water Technical Assistance Act authorizes grants for nonprofit small treatment works technical assistance providers to offer onsite technical assistance, training programs, and regional assistance to help small treatment works comply with the Act or secure financing. $15,000,000 is authorized for grants for fiscal years 2018 through 2022. "Technical assistance for medium treatment works is provided under SEC. 223." In this section, definitions for medium treatment works and qualified nonprofit medium treatment works technical assistance provider are provided. The Administrator may use amounts for technical assistance. The Administrator may use funds to provide grants or agreements to nonprofit technical assistance providers for medium treatment works. This includes onsite assistance, circuit-rider programs, and training to help with compliance and financing. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year 2018 through 2022. The Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1383) is amended to allow states to use an additional 2 percent of funds for nonprofit small and medium treatment works technical assistance providers. This funding is for providing technical assistance as defined in sections 222 and 223. The Control Act is amended to allow states to use an additional 2 percent of funds for technical assistance providers for small and medium treatment works. Section 221(d) is also amended to reflect this change.
